bioghist.p: Evelyn Cook Bauerly (Mrs. Gordon Bauerly) majored in chemistry and biology at Ursinus College, graduating in 1930. She worked for Benjamin Gruskin in his lab at Temple Medical School. The lab was funded by the Lake Land College Foundation of Chicago, and reports were sent to Mr. Harbison and Mr. Hubacheck at the foundation. Gruskin was a scientist at Temple University. He was born in Vilno, Lithuania and emigrated to the U.S. [date unknown]. He did graduate work at Loyola University in Illinois. He studied the therapeutic use of chlorophyll in medicine and dentistry.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains correspondence from the Lake Land College Foundation, addressed to Evelyn Bauerle (1949-1966); reprints by Benjamin Gruskin and others; and a report on the Gruskin antigens and serums.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
